children.name: mount
children.definition: to get on a horse in order to ride : lên (ngựa)
examples: She mounted her horse and rode off.
to mount on a horse
dismount[ I ] to get off a horse xuống (ngựa)

children.name: ride
children.definition: to sit on an animal, especially a horse, and make it move along : cưỡi
examples: She learned to ride when she was seven.
He was riding a large grey mare.
ride on
She arrived riding on a white horse.
ride away/across/through etc
He rode away across the marshes.

children.name: saddle
children.definition: to put a saddle on a horse : thắng yên (ngựa)
examples: She saddled the horse for her friend.
saddle up[M]
He was in the stable, saddling up his horse.
unsaddle[ T ] to take the saddle off a horse tháo yên (ngựa)
I unsaddled the horse and tied it near lots of grass.

children.name: rein in
children.definition: to make a horse go more slowly or stop by pulling on its reins : gò cương, ghì cương (ngựa)

children.name: jodhpurs
children.definition: trousers which are loose above the knees and tight below them and which are designed to be worn when riding a horse : quần đi ngựa
examples: a newpair ofjodhpurs

children.name: spur
children.definition: a sharp, metal, wheel-shaped object which is fixed to the heel of boots worn by people riding horses and is used to encourage the horse to go faster đinh thúc ngựa
examples: spur[ T ] to push spurs into the side of a horse to make it go faster thúc (ngựa)
He spurred his horseonand shouted "Faster! Faster!"

children.name: show jumping
children.definition: a sport in which horses with riders have to jump a series of fences as quickly and skilfully as possible cưỡi ngựa vượt chướng ngại vật
examples: show jumper[C] a rider or horse that takes part in show jumping

children.name: dressage
children.definition: a competition in which a horse performs a complicated series of movements in answer to signals from its rider biểu diễn kỹ thuật ngựa
examples: a dressage competition

children.name: riding
children.definition: the sport or activity of riding horses : môn cưỡi ngựa
examples: Have you ever been riding?
ridingbootsand a ridinghat
go riding
Shall wego ridingon Saturday?
Shegoesriding on Saturdays.
horse ridingUK [specific]
riding school/stables(= place where people learn to ride horses )

children.name: prance
children.definition: if a horse prances, it moves with high steps way đi cao chân
examples: prance around
the pony was prancing around the paddock

children.name: gallop
children.definition: if a horse gallops, it moves very fast with all its feet leaving the ground together : phi nước đại
examples: A neighbour’s horse came galloping down the road, riderless.
a galloping horse

children.name: trot
children.definition: if a horse or similar animal with four legs trots, it runs at its slowest speed, using short steps in which a front leg and the back leg on the opposite side move together
examples: We were trottingalongthe lane when a car suddenly appeared from nowhere and almost made me fall off my pony.
The dog trotteddownthe path to greet me.
trot[ S ] the speed or movement of a horse or similar animal when it trots nước kiệu
He climbed onto his horse and set offat arelaxed trot down the lane.

children.name: buck
children.definition: (of a horse) to jump into the air and kick out with the back legs: nhảy chụm bốn vó

children.name: canter
children.definition: If a horse canters, it moves at quite a fast but easy and comfortable speed: chạy nước kiệu
examples: The riders cantered round the field a few times.
canter[C usually S]
The horses set off at a canter.

children.name: horseshoe
children.definition: nounFOR A HORSE sắt bịt móng, bịt móng ngựa
examples: [ C ] a U-shaped piece of metal which is fixed to the bottom of a horse'shoofto protect it
_For many people the horseshoe is a symbol of good luck.
shoeverb[ T ]đóng móng (ngựa)shoeing, shodorUS ALSOshoed
If you shoe a horse, you nail ahorseshoe(= a curved piece of metal) to one or each of its feet.

children.name: saddle
children.definition: nounSEAT yên ngựa; yên xe
examples: [ C ] a seat, often made of leather, used on a horse, bicycle, motorcycle, etc.
_He swung himself into the saddle and rode off.
sidesaddlenoun[ C ] ,adverb yên ngồi nghiêng
(yên ngựa dùng cho nữ kị sĩ,ngồi cả hai chân cùng một phía)
(on) asaddleused especially in the past by women, on which the rider sits with both legson the same side of the horse
_The Queen rode sidesaddle when she inspected the soldiers.
stirrupnoun[ C ] bàn đạp ngựa (thõng từ yên ngựa xuống để đặt chân)
one of a pair of pieces of metal shaped like the letter D that hang from the side of a horse'ssaddleand which is used for resting your foot in when you are riding
girthnounHORSE EQUIPMENT đai yên (để thắt chặt yên vào ngựa )
[ C ] the strap which goes around the middle of a horse to keep thesaddle(= rider'sseat) or theloadin the right position
_Loosen the girth a little.
pommelnoun[ C ] quả táo yên ngựa
the usually rounded part that sticks up at the front of a saddle

children.name: bit
children.definition: nounHORSE hàm thiếc ngựa
examples: a piece of metal put in a horse's mouth to allow the person riding it to control its movements
snafflenoun[ C ] hàm thiếc ngựa
a type ofbit(= metal bar held in a horse's mouth to control it) usually with ajointin the middle

children.name: bridle
children.definition: noun dây cương (cả một bộ)
examples: a set of leather strips that are put around a horse's head to allow its rider to control it
bridleverbCONTROL ANIMAL thắng cương (cho ngựa)
[ T ] to put a bridle on a horse or similar animal
_Polly saddled and bridled her favourite horse.
reinnoun[ C usually plural ] dây cương( chỉ phần dây bạn cầm )
a long thin piece of material, especially leather, which helps you to control and direct a horse
_You pull on both reins to stop or slow a horse, but only the left rein to turn left.

children.name: whip
children.definition: nounDEVICE FOR HITTING roi da; roi
examples: [ C ] a piece of leather or rope which is fastenedto a stick, used for hitting animals orpeople
_She lashed the horses mercilessly with her long whip.
_The lion-tamercrackedhis whip.

children.name: saddlery
children.definition: noun đồ yên cương ( phần đồ da )
examples: leather objects, such as saddles andbridles, for horses
saddlernoun[ C ]thợ làm yên cương; người bán yên cương
a person who makes, sells and repairs saddles and other leather objects for horses

children.name: blinkers
children.definition: UK(USblinders)miếng che mắt ngựa (để ngựa chỉ nhìn thấy phía trước)
examples: two pieces of leather that are put at the side of a horse's eyes so that it can only see forward
blinders miếng che mắt ngựa (để ngựa chỉ nhìn thấy phía trước)
[ plural ]US forblinkers

children.name: riding school
children.definition: noun trường cưỡi ngựa
examples: a place where you can learn to ride horses

children.name: riderless
children.definition: without a person riding không người cưỡi
examples: a riderless horse

children.name: unseat
children.definition: If a horse unseats its rider,it throws them from its back: hất, làm ngã (ngựa, xe đạp..)

children.name: on horseback
children.definition: riding a horse trên lưng ngựa
examples: police on horseback

children.name: in the saddle
children.definition: riding a horse cưỡi ngựa
examples: We did six or eight hours in the saddle every day.

children.name: mounted
children.definition: describes soldiers or police officers who ride horses while on duty : cưỡi ngựa
examples: mounted police officers
Jean was mounted on a grey mare.

children.name: groom
children.definition: a person whose job is to take care of and clean horses : nhân viên chăm sóc ngựa

children.name: horseman
children.definition: a person who rides a horse, especially sb who rides well : kỵ sĩ
examples: Harvey was a very good rider and an excellent horseman.
horsewoman[C] a female horseman nữ kỵ sĩ
She's a keen horsewoman.
horsemanship[U] skill at riding horses thuật cưỡi ngựa

children.name: equestrian
children.definition: formal a person who rides horses, especially as a job or very skilfully: kỵ sĩ
examples: It's such a rugged topography that equestrians generally don't bother.
equestrian[adj] connected with the riding of horses
They plan to hold the Olympics' equestrianeventsin another part of the city.
his amazing equestrian skills

children.name: rider
children.definition: sb who rides a horse, bicycle etc: người cưỡi
examples: One of the riders was thrown off his horse.
a horse and rider

children.name: whoa
children.definition: exclamationused when telling a horse to stop đứng lại!; dừng lại!
examples: "Whoa there, Poppy," he said to his pony, and pulled up beside the kerb.

children.name: (of a rider) riding without a saddle
bareback
children.definition: without a saddle on the back of a horse that is being ridden không yên
examples: a bareback rider
Is it difficultridingbareback?
